original: LEMOINE, Axel Siffer, Byrådirektör, Lidingö, f Väddö, Sthlms l, 6/5 91 av skom.m Oskar L o Sophia Nordström, gm Eyvor Sundberg. Studex Upps 09, civ.ing KTH (el.-tekn) 14. Anst marinförvaltn 15—17, tel.styr :s radiobyrå sed. 17, byrådir sed. 36. Ordf Sam-arb.deleg mot radiostörn sed. 30, led Sv nat.-komm f vetensk radio sed. 31, v. ordf sed. 34, led av Radiotjänsts programråd 25—35, av radionämnden sed. 36, 41 års polisradioutredn, sakk i radioärend v fi utl tel.förvaltn, omb v världskonf f radioär Washington 27, Madrid 32 samt ett 40-t int europ konf, div konsult uppdr, led Union Int de Radio diffusion, Co-mité Techn 25—38, v. ordf Sv tekn.frn:s avd f el.tekn 27, led frus styr 35—37. Planl o uppf storradiostn i Grimeton samt flert sv kommers radio- o rundr.stner, tekn ch o pro-gr.ch sv rundrad 23—24, planl o omhänderh inredn av Radiotj :s studielokaler t 35, sakk vid professur KTH samt öl slags spec uppdr på radiotekn omr. Resor: USA 20, 23, 27, ett st ant i europ länd. Av trycket: Princip, framställn av glödkatedrörens verkn.sätt samt användn v mottagn inom radiotelegr (20), Fr mikrof t högtalaren (29), Sthlm-Motala (33), Radio (Tekn folkbibi 40), ett st antal art o upps om radio. RNO, RVO, RNS:tOO, LIVA. Hobby: Motorboatirig.
translated: LEMOINE, Axel Siffer, Bureau Director, Lidingö, born in Väddö, Stockholm county, May 6th, 1891, to shoemaker Oskar L and Sophia Nordström, married to Eyvor Sundberg. Graduated from Uppsala University in 1909, received a degree in Electrical Engineering from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1914. Employed by the Naval Administration from 1915 to 1917, then transferred to the Telecommunications Board, specifically the Radio Bureau, from 1917. Promoted to Bureau Director in 1936. Chairman of the Joint Cooperation Delegation against Radio Interference from 1930, member of the Swedish National Committee for Scientific Radio from 1931, Vice Chairman from 1934, member of the Radio Service Program Council from 1925 to 1935, member of the Radio Board from 1936, involved in the 1941 Police Radio Investigation, expert in international telecommunications matters, attended conferences in Washington in 1927, Madrid in 1932, and numerous European conferences. Worked as a consultant and was a member of the International Broadcasting Union, Technical Committee from 1925 to 1938, Vice Chairman of the Swedish Technical Society Division of Electrical Engineering from 1927, member of the Swedish Radio Corporation Board from 1935 to 1937. Involved in the planning and construction of the large radio station in Grimeton, as well as multiple commercial radio and broadcasting stations in Sweden. Technical and programming chief for Swedish radio from 1923 to 1924, involved in the planning and management of the study facilities at the Radio Corporation from 1935, served as an expert at the KTH professorship and performed various special assignments in the field of radio technology. Traveled to the United States in 1920, 1923, and 1927, as well as several European countries. Published several works, including "Principles, Production of the Glow Tube's Operating Principle and the Use of Reception in Radiotelegraphy" (1920), "From Microphone to Loudspeaker" (1929), "Stockholm-Motala" (1933), "Radio" (Technical Public Library 1940), along with numerous articles and essays on radio. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Commander of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav. Hobbies: Motorboating.
